* Iron Raptor growled and felt anger flair when she heard Angel Prime's 
transmission.Weak?! All she was trying to do was end the battle and now he 
was calling her weak?!
She felt like wringing his neck! But she knew that she couldn't, and since 
she couldn't she wouldn.t*

" So trying to save a Maximal is weak?" she said over the comm to Angel 
Prime only. " Let me tell you something! It takes more then guts and will to 
fight to make a leader. You may think I'm weak and you're welcome to your 
own opinion. And if you're not happy then you are welcome to leave! But as 
long as I'm commander we'll fight for peace and not bloodshed."

* She closed her com to Angel Prime and opened it to the remainder of the 
Maximals.*

" Maximals. Obviously you heard the chindish antics of a certain Maximal 
that has war on the brain. I know you don't like this and neither do I, but 
I don't want the death of Chordate on our hands. I've tried to be paitent 
and I'm sorry if this upsets you. I've tried."

* Iron Raptor then sighed and closed the comm. She turned towards the 
Maximals that were around her. Giving them a look which spoke that she was 
completely lost. < All I did was try and do something right, and I get 
yelled at.> she thought.
Iron Raptor turned towards FZ.*

" You can have the prisiners. But in exchange for Chordate. We'll do the 
exchange in an hour in neutral territory. If your Alliance leaves the 
Maximals won't follow. The battle will be over."

* Iron Rapto leaned back.
Why did the Maximals do this? Why did they have to be so cruel?  All she had 
tried to do was save someone. Now she was sure that most of them hated her. 
Just because she had done something to try and make things better.
Deep inside a slight depression sank in, nothing that showed on the outside 
but a side to her that said that it wasn't worth fighting with, but another 
side that told her to keep going. And that was the side she would listen to.
Now it was up to the Alliance to accept her new offer.
But she still had hope that the Maximals would listen, even if it was for a 
second. They weren't bad, just eager to win.
She wanted to win too, but it was already too late and a victory wouldn't be 
today.
But she had plans, she was biding her time now.
Soom, the enemies of the Maximals would quiver at the name.*
